subsection.name: Default configuration
subsection.p: In the jspider.properties file for a given configuration, the following lines control the firewall/proxy settings (taken from a freshly installed JSpider instance):
subsection.source:
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Proxy Configuration # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # This section controls the proxy server/firewall configuration. If you want # JSpider to be able to access websites on the internet, and you have to pass # a proxyserver, you can configure this here. # These are general proxy settings, if some hosts are accessible without using # a proxy server, you can configure not to use a proxy server for these hosts # in the host-specific configuration file. # # PROPERTIES : # jspider.proxy.use # determines whether a proxy server should be used (true/false) # the other jspider.proxy.* settings are only applicable if # jspider.proxy.use is set to true # # jspider.proxy.host # DNS name or IP address of the proxy server to use # # jspider.proxy.port # port the proxy server is listening on # # jspider.proxy.authenticate # whether authentication should be used (true/false) # # jspider.proxy.user # user account on the proxy server to be used # only applicable if jspider.proxy.authenticate=true # # jspider.proxy.password # password of the account on the proxy server # only applicable if jspider.proxy.authenticate=true # # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
jspider.proxy.use=false jspider.proxy.host= jspider.proxy.port= jspider.proxy.authenticate=false jspider.proxy.user= jspider.proxy.password=
subsection.p: This configuration is complete when accessing only local sites with JSpider, or when you have a direct internet connection that doesn't have to pass a proxy server or firewall.

subsection.name: Configuration Parameters
subsection.p: An explanation of each individual parameter:

tr.td: Determines whether a proxy server is to be used
DNS Name or IP Address of the proxy server machine
Port on which the proxy server is listening
Whether you need to provide a login/password to the proxyserver.
Username of the account needed to authenticate on the proxy serves. Only needed when jspider.proxy.authenticate is set to true
Password of the account needed to authenticate on the proxy server. Only needed when jspider.proxy.authenticate is set to true

subsection.name: Example configuration
subsection.p: Just to be clear, here is an (imaginary) sample configuration for someone that needs to authenticate on his ISP's proxy server:
subsection.source: jspider.proxy.use=true jspider.proxy.host=proxy.myisp.com jspider.proxy.port=8080 jspider.proxy.authenticate=true jspider.proxy.user=myaccount jspider.proxy.password=mypassword
subsection.p: With this configuration, a proxy server is used on proxy.myisp.com:8080, on which we login with user 'myaccount', password 'mypassword'.
